section.title: Sample Textbook Section
section.p: An ordered list of numbers s_1,s_2,s_3,\ldots is called a sequence. The numbers in the list are called the entries or terms in the sequence.

A linear sequence is a sequence that has the form a,\; a+d,\; a+d+d,\; a+d+d+d, \ldots for some constants a and d, so that each entry is equal to d plus the previous entry. A linear sequence can be written in the simplified form a,\; a+d,\; a+2d,\; a+3d,\ldots . For example, the positive odd numbers 1,3,5,7,\ldots is a linear sequence with a=1 and d=2.

An exponential sequence is a sequence that has the form a, ar, arr, arrr, \ldots for some constants a and r, so that each entry is equal to r times the previous entry. An exponential sequence can be written in the simplified form a,ar,ar^2,ar^3,\ldots . For example, the doubling sequence 1,2,4,8,16,\ldots is an exponential sequence with a=1 and r=2.
